column4: hello i would liketo add space to my ubuntu partition any help appreciated, thanks
Boot from a liveCD and resize the partition with gparted.
Then you'll have to go buy some blank CDs ( or upgrade to GRUB2 :)
I didn't realize you were running 9.04, you probably don't want to upgrade to grub2 before upgrading to 9.10.
ok then it wonl let me upgrade because i need disk space but i dont have blank cds or flash drive so can i just use gparted and apply after restart or something

You will need to upgrade to 9.10, upgrade to grub2, download the parted magic liveCD, and modify /etc/grub.d/40_custom to add an entry to boot from the parted magic iso. Are you sure you can do all that without running out of space first?
i have not enough space and no blank cds
What is currently using the space that you would resize the Ubuntu partition into?
i selected about only 10gb at the first install...
And the rest is free space?
no i dont know this is my couzings computer but i think its just installed aplications
To resize the Ubuntu partition you need free space to resize it into.
the windows aprtition has like 60 gb
